name: Geopolitical Simulations
description: Modeling geopolitical conflicts, economic shifts, and international crises.

cards.title: Wargaming & Strategic Conflict Simulations
cards.description: Using scenario-based models to anticipate international conflicts.
bulletpoints: Simulate potential military conflicts using historical data and Artificial Intelligence (AI) models
Analyze strategic movements of state and non-state actors in global conflicts
Apply game theory to predict adversarial decision-making and escalation patterns
cards.summaryText: Run AI-aided wargames to anticipate conflict pathways and escalation decisions.

cards.title: Economic Forecasting & Global Market Analysis
cards.description: Predicting financial market shifts and macroeconomic trends.
bulletpoints: Use economic indicators like Gross Domestic Product (GDP), Consumer Price Index (CPI), and trade balances to forecast inflation and recession risks
Analyze the impact of trade policies, international sanctions, and global supply chain disruptions
Identify emerging market opportunities and economic vulnerabilities for strategic positioning
cards.summaryText: Simulate macro shocks and policy shifts to gauge global market trajectories.

cards.title: Energy Crisis & Resource Conflict Modeling
cards.description: Simulating the impact of energy shortages and resource-driven geopolitical tensions.
bulletpoints: Analyze the role of oil, gas, and rare-earth minerals in international conflicts
Model supply chain disruptions caused by energy crises or trade restrictions
Assess the geopolitical influence of energy superpowers like Russia, Saudi Arabia, and the United States
cards.summaryText: Model critical resource chokepoints to foresee energy-triggered conflicts.

cards.title: Cyber Warfare & Digital Conflict Simulations
cards.description: Modeling state-sponsored cyber attacks and global cybersecurity threats.
bulletpoints: Analyze the impact of cyber attacks on national security, financial systems, and infrastructure
Use attack tree analysis to simulate adversary cyber strategies
Assess cyber warfare as a tool for asymmetric conflict and hybrid warfare scenarios
cards.summaryText: Map adversary cyber playbooks to evaluate systemic risk and defensive gaps.

cards.title: Climate Change & Geopolitical Instability
cards.description: Simulating geopolitical consequences of environmental disasters and resource scarcity.
bulletpoints: Model migration patterns resulting from climate-driven displacement
Analyze how rising sea levels and extreme weather affect national security
Assess geopolitical tensions over water access and arable land scarcity
cards.summaryText: Project climate shocks to anticipate migration waves and resource tensions.

cards.title: AI-Driven Psychological Operations (PsyOps) & Disinformation Warfare
cards.description: Simulating the influence of AI-powered propaganda and information warfare.
bulletpoints: Examine how generative AI and deepfake technology shape public perception
Model the spread of disinformation campaigns and social media manipulation
Analyze how AI-driven PsyOps impact election security and civil unrest
cards.summaryText: Assess AI-powered disinformation campaigns to forecast perception battles.

cards.title: Nuclear Deterrence & Strategic Stability Modeling
cards.description: Assessing nuclear strategy, deterrence theory, and escalation dynamics.
bulletpoints: Apply Mutually Assured Destruction (MAD) theory to strategic simulations
Analyze the role of second-strike capability in nuclear deterrence
Model crisis scenarios involving nuclear proliferation and diplomatic resolutions
cards.summaryText: Explore deterrence scenarios to map escalation ladders and stability thresholds.

cards.title: Global Supply Chain Disruption Simulations
cards.description: Modeling vulnerabilities in global trade networks and logistics systems.
bulletpoints: Analyze how supply chain bottlenecks impact geopolitical stability
Simulate the effects of trade wars, sanctions, and industrial espionage
Assess the strategic importance of rare-earth elements and semiconductor manufacturing
cards.summaryText: Stress-test global supply chains to pinpoint strategic vulnerabilities and leverage points.

cards.title: Biological Warfare & Pandemic Response Modeling
cards.description: Simulating global pandemic responses and biosecurity threats.
bulletpoints: Assess how pandemics impact international relations and economic stability
Analyze the role of bioterrorism in modern warfare scenarios
Model government response strategies, including quarantine enforcement and vaccine diplomacy
cards.summaryText: Simulate pandemics and biothreats to refine response and resilience strategies.

cards.title: Great Power Competition & Global Hegemony
cards.description: Modeling strategic rivalries between major world powers.
bulletpoints: Analyze the shifting balance of power between the United States, China, Russia, and the European Union
Assess military posturing, economic policies, and soft power strategies
Simulate scenarios where regional conflicts escalate into global crises
cards.summaryText: Model great-power rivalries to anticipate shifts in global hegemony and crisis escalation.
